ygData.subject: Re:
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been there a few times in the past few weeks during evening primetime and rarely were there more than 4 ppl in the zone..usually no one was there. Glad
ygData.messageBody:
I have been there a few times in the past few weeks during evening primetime
and rarely were there more than 4 ppl in the zone..usually no one was there.
Glad I got the drop from Kurrpok already :-) because if it turns into a
Kithicor like zone I won't be going back for a while.


>Producer Brad McQuaid responds to the dungeon upgrade:
>>From the Druid's Grove:
>----------------------------------------------------------
>Saturday night Test was treated to a rare GM event in which high level
>(high
>20's to mid-30's) gnolls were in South Karana running around killing
>people
>like most typical GM events seem to be. I did not participate but today
>some
>friends told me that afterwards SplitPaw had been revamped in much the
>same
>way that Kithicor has and to come check it out. I have not had a chance
>to
>do so much yet but I can say that the level has been increased to about
>a
>30-50 lvl dungeon from what I have seen and heard with gnolls conning
>blue
>to me at 40th at the first bridge area. Not sure if it has been reitemized
>but I am hoping it will be, if so it will be another nice upgrade to
>a zone
>that Verant has made recently.
>
>Agreed -- lower level players rarely went to Paw, probably because of
>it's
>distance. So, now that most of our players are approaching mid-level,
> we've
>changed the zone's population (and treasure) in hopes it will be more
>popular now.
>
>---------------------------------------------
>Brad McQuaid
>Producer, EverQuest www.everquest.com
>Vice President, Verant Interactive Inc.
>---------------------------------------------
>
